events.title: Historic Orders Emerge from Advanced H.Q. of Eighth Army as Winter Approaches – November 24, 1941
General Ritchie Takes Command Amidst Fierce Enemy Counterattack
events.description: When General Ritchie assumed command on the 26th November the force of the enemy’s counterstroke was by no means spent. Showing great boldness and vigour, the enemy had driven eastwards on the 24th November with the greater part of his remaining tanks and lorried infantry, causing considerable havoc in our rearward areas amongst transport and headquarters.

events.title: General Ritchie Takes Charge Amidst Renewed Enemy Onslaught
events.description: When General Ritchie assumed command on the 26th November the force of the enemy’s counterstroke was by no means spent. Showing great boldness and vigour, the enemy had driven eastwards on the 24th November with the greater part of his remaining tanks and lorried infantry, causing considerable havoc in our rearward areas amongst transport and headquarters.

events.title: Oases Force Secures Gialo in Strategic Capture Led by Brigadier Reid
events.description: The Oases Force under Brigadier Reid had. captured Gialo on the 24th November and squadrons of aircraft based on the landing

events.title: General Freyberg Advances: NZ Infantry Captures Gambut Aerodrome in Tactical Move
events.description: Leaving the 5th New Zealand Infantry Brigade to watch the enemy in Bardia and Halfaya, General Freyberg moved westwards with the remainder of the division on the 23rd November. Having captured Gambut aerodrome the same afternoon, they joined the 6th Brigade at Point 175 on the 24th November.

events.title: Allied Forces Ready for Offensive: Advance Toward Tebourba-Mateur Set to Begin
events.description: By 24th November the forward concentration of 78 Division and Blade Force, reinforced by light tanks from the United States 1 Armoured Division, was completed and orders were issued for the immediate resumption of the advance with, as a first objective, the line TebourbaMateur. :

events.title: Strategic Military Shuffle: R.A.A.F. Squadrons Mobilize Ahead of Potential Operations in Malaysia
events.description: . (@) Formed Headquarters Noratoup which assembled on 24th November at Kuala ‘Lumpur alongside Headquarters [IIrd Indian Corps. The Commander appointed was Wing Commander R. G. Forbes, Station Commander, Alor Star, in the absence of the Commander ‘designate, Group Captain A. G. Bishop, who was away in South China. (See para. 106.) (b) Ordered No. 2r (F) Squadron, R.A.A.F., to move to Sungei Patani: move , to be completed by 25th November. (c) Put No. 34 (B) Squadron (Blenheim IV) at short notice to move to Alor Star.  (d@) Made provisional arrangements for the »move of No. 60 (B) Squadron aircraft (7 Blenheims) out of Kuantan to Butterworth. This move’ would be necessary if the reconnaissance plan were to be brought into force because No. 8 (GR) Squadron, R.A.A.F. ica require the accommodation at Kuantan _ for carrying out that plan. ,
